intro: Ctenopsis delicatula, commonly known as the slender feather moss, is a member of the family Hypnaceae and is native to moist, shaded environments in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a small, mat-forming moss that typically grows on soil, rocks, or decaying wood, often in forest understories. The plant has delicate, branching shoots that are covered in tiny, leaf-like structures called phyllodes, which help in water retention. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are usually small and inconspicuous, developing from the tips of the shoots. Ctenopsis delicatula plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for various invertebrates.
